Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pathetical \Pa*thet"ic*al\, a. Pathetic. [R.] -- {Pa*thet"ic*al*ly}, adv. -- {Pa*thet"ic*al*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]

pathetically adv 1: in a manner arousing sympathy and compassion; "the sick child cried pathetically" [syn: {pitiably}] 2: arousing scornful pity; "they had pathetically little money"; "it was pathetically bad"
